bibl.title: Monetisation, not Price-Inflation, in Third-Century A.D. Egypt?
bibl.note: "It is not safe to believe that the third-century empire in general suffered from serious price-inflation before the 270s, nor that as a general principle the increasing supply of coinage and its reductions in weight and fineness are likely to have led to price-inflation."
